prerequisites: Python backend services for content processing
setup_steps: 1. Configure OAuth2 credentials for each platform
2. Set up database tables for analytics storage
4. Import workflow JSON files into n8n
6. Set up monitoring and error handling

database_tables: CREATE TABLE portfolio_analytics (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, project_id VARCHAR(50), title VARCHAR(255), platforms JSONB, metrics JSONB, created_at TIMESTAMP);
CREATE TABLE linkedin_analytics (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, post_id VARCHAR(50), content TEXT, hashtags TEXT[], engagement_score FLOAT, published_at TIMESTAMP);

CREATE TABLE content_distribution (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, distribution_id VARCHAR(50), original_content JSONB, platforms JSONB, success_count INTEGER, failure_count INTEGER, success_rate FLOAT, distributed_at TIMESTAMP);

CREATE TABLE social_media_analytics (id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY, timestamp TIMESTAMP, total_platforms INTEGER, successful_platforms INTEGER, total_followers BIGINT, average_engagement_rate FLOAT, platform_performance JSONB, insights TEXT[], recommendations TEXT[]);
